discoveredAssets: localhost:5001 - Dalgona Challenges CTF Platform (Python/Werkzeug 1.0.1) - Port 5001, HTTP only
http://localhost:5001/ - Main web application (Single Page Application) - GET/HEAD/OPTIONS methods allowed
/static/css/xss/index.css - XSS challenge stylesheet (1000 bytes) - HTTP 200, cache: 43200s
Challenge endpoint 'xss25' (href present in HTML) - Returns 404 (Not Implemented)

targets.objective: Test for common web vulnerabilities including XSS in homepage forms and links, injection attacks on any input parameters, and authentication bypass if login functionality exists
targets.rationale: Homepage is the primary entry point; currently shows XSS 25 challenge link which may indicate vulnerable input handling or stored XSS vulnerabilities being tested by the platform

targets.objective: Test for missing or broken endpoint handling, directory traversal, path traversal attacks, or access control bypass if endpoint becomes functional
targets.rationale: Endpoint referenced in homepage HTML but returns 404; potential for authorization bypass or unimplemented feature exploitation if authentication/conditional access exists

targets.objective: Test for directory listing vulnerability, path traversal to access non-static files, and file inclusion vulnerabilities through static asset serving
targets.rationale: Static directory returns 404 (good security practice), but static files are served; test for path traversal attacks using ../ sequences to access application files

targets.objective: Identify and test for known vulnerabilities in Python 2.7.18 (EOL since 2020) and Werkzeug 1.0.1, including potential debug mode activation, pickle/serialization vulnerabilities, and HTTP parsing weaknesses
targets.rationale: End-of-life technology stack with known security vulnerabilities and lack of security updates; potential for version-specific exploits and misconfigurations

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Outdated technology stack: Python 2.7.18 (EOL January 2020) and Werkzeug 1.0.1 (2020 release) - no security updates available, likely vulnerable to known CVEs
[HIGH] POST method rejected (405 Method Not Allowed) on root endpoint - suggests simple GET-only server configuration, potential for business logic testing on actual endpoints if implemented
[MEDIUM] XSS 25 challenge endpoint returns 404 despite being linked in homepage HTML - indicates incomplete implementation, unprotected endpoint, or client-side only routing
[MEDIUM] No visible authentication or authorization mechanisms - all accessible resources appear public with no login/registration endpoints discovered
[LOW] Static files are caching-enabled (max-age=43200) with proper HTTP headers, reducing immediate attack surface for cache poisoning
[LOW] Application uses HTTP only (no TLS/HTTPS) - acceptable for localhost-only deployment but would be critical vulnerability if exposed to network
[INFORMATIONAL] Simple HTML structure with minimal JavaScript - likely server-side rendering only with basic interactivity
[INFORMATIONAL] CSS files reference background image (dalgonabg.jpg) that doesn't exist (404) - suggests incomplete deployment or removed assets
